comments.author: ovaalst@gmx.com
comments.creator: ovaalst@gmx.com
comments.text:
Created attachment 564991
Kraken Nightly (Okt. 5 2011) - X64 vs X86.jpg

User Agent: Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 6.1; WOW64; rv:7.0.1) Gecko/20100101 Firefox/7.0.1
Build ID: 20110928134238

Steps to reproduce:

On Windows 7 (64-bit), I compared the Kraken benchmark of x86 build of nightly with the x64 build. 


Actual results:

Although most benchmark were similar or slightly faster with the 64-bit version, the ai-astar test was considerably slower: 526.4 ms vs 322.6. This also happened with 9 nightly (with TI)


Expected results:

I expected a similar performance.
comments.raw_text:
User Agent: Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 6.1; WOW64; rv:7.0.1) Gecko/20100101 Firefox/7.0.1
Build ID: 20110928134238

Steps to reproduce:

On Windows 7 (64-bit), I compared the Kraken benchmark of x86 build of nightly with the x64 build. 


Actual results:

Although most benchmark were similar or slightly faster with the 64-bit version, the ai-astar test was considerably slower: 526.4 ms vs 322.6. This also happened with 9 nightly (with TI)


Expected results:

I expected a similar performance.
Is it possible that the working set fits in your cache in the 32-bit build but not the 64-bit one?
comments.text: Is it possible that the working set fits in your cache in the 32-bit build but not the 64-bit one?
comments.author: bzbarsky@mit.edu
comments.creator: bzbarsky@mit.edu

comments.raw_text: I assume you mean CPU-cache? That could indeed be the case. I did not test this on other machines.
comments.creator: ovaalst@gmx.com
comments.text: I assume you mean CPU-cache? That could indeed be the case. I did not test this on other machines.
comments.author: ovaalst@gmx.com
bzbarsky@mit.edu
comments.creator: bzbarsky@mit.edu
comments.text:
Yeah, the CPU cache.  Over here (Mac), what I see is that a 32-bit build gives me:

    astar:                     132.3ms +/- 4.7%

while a 64-bit build gives me:

    astar:                     149.3ms +/- 1.2%

in my case I have a 4MB shared L3 and a 265KB per-core L2...
comments.raw_text:
Yeah, the CPU cache.  Over here (Mac), what I see is that a 32-bit build gives me:

    astar:                     132.3ms +/- 4.7%

while a 64-bit build gives me:

    astar:                     149.3ms +/- 1.2%

in my case I have a 4MB shared L3 and a 265KB per-core L2...

comments.author: ovaalst@gmx.com
comments.creator: ovaalst@gmx.com
comments.text: I don't have L3 cache, I have 512KB per-core L2, so I guess this must be the reason for my larger difference.
comments.raw_text: I don't have L3 cache, I have 512KB per-core L2, so I guess this must be the reason for my larger difference.
